text: whenever anyone asks me for a simple yet
impressive dinner
I tell them make roast chicken it's
literally the easiest thing that you can
make and we've made several on this show
today I'm going to show you a new
version with 40 cloves of garlic it's
super delicious very very classic French
bistro fare the first thing you have to
do is peel 40 cloves of garlic boy how
are you gonna do that I have a trick for
you take two metal bowls take your heads
of garlic I'm gonna do two at a time put
them in the bowl top with a second Bowl
exactly the same size it makes a ton of
noise but it's so much easier than
peeling at all once I don't know I'm not
really sure it's worth the mess it still
saves a tremendous amount of time it is
fun and it gets your aggressions out
that's it so I have a chicken here it's
in a cast-iron skillet
three-and-a-half to four pounds perfect
amount for a family of four make sure it
sits at room temperature for about 1
hour so then what you want to do is rub
a tablespoon of soft butter over your
chicken make sure that your chicken is
really really dry otherwise your butter
will not stick you'll get all pissed off
you'll be rubbing it it'll be sliding
all over the place you'll say why did
she tell me to do that if it's not going
to work I'm mad at her I'm not watching
her videos anymore
you'll write me in comments on YouTube
everybody will stop watching and then
everyone will suffer once the chicken is
done then you just take your 40 cloves
of garlic and you surround the chicken
in the pan with the garlic take some
time put that in the pan don't forget to
season both sides a little bit more
butter just right in the pan this will
help with the juices and the
deliciousness factor and help cook those
garlic's then tie up the legs for even
cooking I like to use a bow because then
it's easier to untie when you get there
at the end
you could always cut it off too and then
put it in your 475 degree oven for 45 60
minutes baste it once or twice for the
most beautiful golden presentation at
the
all right whoa pretty look at that so
golden cooking it in the cast-iron
skillet really makes a big difference it
really intensifies the heat and makes it
nice and golden nice and even cooking I
love it
a wallah a viola
it's tasty juice
so good
fantastic festive and delicious easier
than pie and pretty much everything else
roast chicken with 40 cloves of garlic
make it tonight
